channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Two new suspects handed preliminary charges in Louvre jewels heist case, Paris prosecutor says
item.description: The Paris prosecutor says two new suspects have been handed preliminary charges for their alleged involvement in the crown jewels heist at the Louvre museum.
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Corbet, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Ukraine says it hit a key fuel pipeline near Moscow that supplies Russian forces
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukrainian forces hit an important fuel pipeline in the Moscow region that supplies the Russian army, Ukraine's military intelligence said Saturday, as Russia kept up a sustained campaign of massive drone and missile attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: SAMYA KULLAB, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Rubio, Vance see growing speculation over their 2028 ambitions
item.description: President Trump floating Vice President Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio as a potential presidential ticket is fueling questions about their working relationship and political futures as chatter about who will lead the 2028 Republican ticket intensifies.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, The Hill

item.title: Israel says the latest remains returned from Gaza are not bodies of hostages
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The remains of three people Hamas handed over to the Red Cross in Gaza do not belong to any hostages, Israel said Saturday, in the latest setback to the U.S.-brokered ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Israel says remains of three people handed over by Hamas do not match any deceased hostages
item.description: Israel's forensic testing reveals that remains of three people returned by Hamas don't match any of the deceased hostages from the Oct. 7, 2023, attacks.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Unidentified remains of 3 people transferred to Israel, Red Cross says
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Red Cross said it transferred the unidentified remains of three people to Israel late Friday but they were still being examined and may not be those of missing hostages, an Israeli military official said.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Red Cross confirms remains of three hostages return to Israel ‘for the first time’ as families await answers
item.description: The International Red Cross oversaw a body transfer under humanitarian law as parties work to return the deceased to families during the ongoing Israel-Hamas conflict.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Andrew, the civilian formerly known as 'prince,' faces an uncertain future
item.description: LONDON (AP) — He has lost his title as prince, lost his rent-free mansion on the sprawling grounds next to Windsor Castle and lost whatever remained of his reputation in the public eye.
item.dc:creator: BRIAN MELLEY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Americans more likely to oppose boat strikes, military invasion of Venezuela: Survey
item.description: A YouGov survey has found that Americans are more likely to oppose U.S. strikes against boats near Venezuela than support them after a month of attacks on vessels suspected of transporting drugs off the country’s coast. Americans also strongly opposed the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Surina Venkat, The Hill

item.title: Militia attack on hospital in Darfur came in waves, WHO says
item.description: The World Health Organization reports that gunmen who reportedly killed at least 460 people at a hospital in Sudan's Darfur region returned three times to the facility during their assault.
item.dc:creator: Jamey Keaten And Sarah El Deeb, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Pakistan says it seeks no further escalation but urges Afghanistan to act against militants
item.description: ISLAMABAD (AP) — Pakistan does not seek further escalation of hostilities with Afghanistan but expects the South Asian country's Taliban rulers to address its security concerns by taking action against militants operating from Afghan soil, Pakistan’s Foreign Ministry said Friday.
item.dc:creator: MUNIR AHMED, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Royal prerogative: King Charles III banishes Andrew to buttress the House of Windsor's foundations
item.description: No one is bigger than the monarchy. Not even the king’s brother. In the end, that reality spelled the end of Andrew’s life as a prince of the realm.
item.dc:creator: DANICA KIRKA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Prince Andrew moves to Sandringham
item.description: Unlike other properties that the royal family inhabits through the Crown Estate, Sandringham is privately owned by the king.
item.dc:creator: Teddy Grant, NewsNation

item.title: New inquest rules South African Nobel laureate Albert Luthuli was beaten to death in 1967
item.description: CAPE TOWN, South Africa (AP) — A new inquest into the 1967 death of South African Nobel Peace Prize winner and anti-apartheid leader Albert Luthuli has found that he was beaten to death, and it rejected a previous finding that he died as a result of being hit by a train.
item.dc:creator: GERALD IMRAY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Ex-Mossad chief behind Iran nuclear warehouse raid says Iran’s atomic sites ‘obliterated,’ credits Trump
item.description: Former Mossad director reveals Iran's nuclear sites were "obliterated" in U.S. strikes, warns Tehran that Israel "can come again" if uranium enrichment resumes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: US defense chief vows to 'stoutly defend' Indo-Pacific interests in talks with China
item.description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia (AP) — The U.S. Secretary of Defense said Friday he told his Chinese counterpart during talks in Malaysia that Washington would “stoutly defend” its interests in the Indo-Pacific. He also signed a new agreement aimed at strengthening security ties with India.
item.dc:creator: EILEEN NG, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Palestinian militants hand over remains of two more hostages to Red Cross in Gaza
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Hospital officials in Gaza say that Israel has handed over the bodies of 30 Palestinians.
item.dc:creator: JULIA FRANKEL and WAFAA SHURAFA, Associated Press, The Hill

item.title: Trump's frustration with Putin goes nuclear, dividing Congress
item.description: President Trump’s decision to restart nuclear weapons testing as a warning to Moscow is being cheered by his Republican allies in Congress, while Democrats fume over what they describe as a dangerous and misguided retaliation.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, The Hill

item.title: Prince Andrew dragged out negotiations before banishment for cash: Source
item.description: Asked if there was a “number” Andrew had in mind, the source said, “I think a couple of million would go a long way.
item.dc:creator: Paula Froelich, NewsNation

item.title: Outrage as Swedish court refuses to deport convicted rapist, PM promises crackdown
item.description: Swedish court sparks outrage by refusing to deport convicted rapist, citing crime wasn't 'exceptionally grave.' PM promises toughest Nordic deportation laws.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Hegseth announces new strike on alleged narco-trafficking boat, killing 4
item.description: The military campaign comes as the U.S. has turned up pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, NewsNation

item.title: Trump directs Pentagon to start testing nuclear weapons
item.description: President Trump said Wednesday that he has instructed the Defense Department to immediately begin testing U.S. nuclear weapons on an equal basis to China and Russia. “The United States has more Nuclear Weapons than any other country,” Trump wrote.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, NewsNation

item.title: Hegseth says military conducted another strike on boat carrying alleged narco-terrorists
item.description: The U.S. military targeted another alleged narco-trafficking boat, sparking congressional concerns over due process and legal authority for the deadly strikes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 4 Senate Republicans vote to rebuke Trump in midst of Canada tariff spat
item.description: The Senate voted 50 to 46 on Wednesday to eliminate President Trump’s authority to impose steep tariffs on Canada, something he exercised again in recent days by ramping up tariffs on the country by another 10 percent because of a television ad that criticized his policies.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, NewsNation

item.title: Israel's military says ceasefire is back on as death toll from Gaza strikes reaches 104
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israel’s military said Wednesday that the ceasefire was back on in Gaza after it carried out heavy airstrikes overnight across the Palestinian territory that killed 104 people, including 66 women and children, according to local health officials.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JOSH BOAK, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: How to help those impacted by Hurricane Melissa
item.description: Hurricane Melissa made landfall in Jamaica on Tuesday as a devastating Category 5 storm, tied for the strongest landfalling Atlantic hurricane in history. The deadly storm has also caused devastation in Cuba, Haiti and the Dominican Republic.
item.dc:creator: GABRIELA AOUN ANGUEIRA, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Antisemitic attacker faced 30-year sentence, gets less than 1½ years in plea deal
item.description: Tarek Bazrouk, a 20-year-old Palestinian American, was sentenced to 17 months in prison for federal hate crimes after attacking Jewish protesters in New York City.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Corpses line Rio street, pushing death toll from police raids to 132
item.description: The police operation came days before Rio hosts global events related to the United Nations climate summit known as COP30
item.dc:creator: Janaina Quinet and Rodrigo Viga Gaier / Reuters, NewsNation

item.title: Hamas victim memorial featuring Shiri Bibas and sons targeted by vandals in Milan, Italy
item.description: Artist AleXsandro Palombo calls the defacement of his Bibas family memorial mural in Milan an antisemitic act disguised as activism rather than legitimate protest.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Amnesty says deadly US strike on Yemen prison may be a war crime
item.description: An American airstrike in April on a prison run by Yemen's Houthi rebels killed more than 60 detained African migrants.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: At least 64 killed in Rio police raids ahead of climate conferences
item.description: Police have often conducted large-scale operations against criminal groups ahead of major events in Rio.
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Viga Gaier / Reuters, NewsNation

item.title: Gaza ceasefire tested as Israel and Hamas exchange fire and blame
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Israeli army launched a barrage of attacks in Gaza on Tuesday as tensions with Hamas grew two weeks into a fragile ceasefire, and the militant group responded by saying it would delay handing over the body of a hostage.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Venezuela suspends energy deals with Trinidad after arrival of US warship
item.description: Trinidad is hosting one of the U.S. warships involved in a controversial campaign to destroy Venezuelan boats allegedly carrying drugs.
item.dc:creator: JORGE RUEDA, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Suspects arrested over the theft of crown jewels from Paris' Louvre museum
item.description: PARIS (AP) — Two suspects were arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre museum, justice and police officials said Sunday, a week after the heist that stunned the world and sparked a massive manhunt.
item.dc:creator: SAMUEL PETREQUIN and NICOLAS GARRIGA, Associated Press, WFLA, NBC
